intro: Takhtajaniantha pusilla, commonly known as the dwarf takhtajanian, is a rare and unique flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the eastern Himalayas. It belongs to the family Takhtajaniaceae, which is known for its distinctive and often showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its small size, with delicate, clustered inflorescences that produce tiny, pale yellow to greenish flowers. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
